summary: The bill, titled the Safety Enhancements for Communities Using Reasonable and Effective Firearm Storage Act (SECURE Firearm Storage Act), amends Title 18 of the United States Code to mandate security requirements for federally licensed firearms importers, manufacturers, and dealers. It requires secure storage of firearms, including specific methods like steel rods, locked safes, and gun cabinets, when premises are closed.  It also adds requirements for secure storage of business records.  The bill outlines penalties for non-compliance, including fines, license suspension, and revocation.  The effective dates for different provisions are specified.
